episode_summary: This episode features discussions on Desert Island Discs, a man who made himself a publicly traded person, drinking habits in British pubs, and the history of Mr. Blobby.

facts.fact: Dame Maura Lympany remains the only castaway on Desert Island Discs to have chosen entirely her own recordings to be marooned with.
A man called Mike Merrill found making decisions so hard that he floated himself as a publicly traded person and for over a decade now has had over 800 people making his decisions for him.
According to a survey of pubs in 1930, the average time someone in Bolton took to drink a pint of beer was 52 minutes. In Liverpool, it was 22 minutes.
When he was approached for the role, the first actor to play Mr. Blobby was simultaneously appearing in Shakespeare's Measure for Measure.
